meanings.definition: A closely woven fabric of silk, cotton, or a similar fiber, with a faint diagonal weave.
meanings.sent1: She admired the soft broadcloths in the store.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used broadcloths to make a beautiful dress.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with a roll of broadcloths, thinking it was a giant toy.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like delicate broadcloths, weaving a story of love and loss.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the broadcloths, revealing their intricate patterns.

meanings.definition: A garment made from broadcloth fabric.
meanings.sent1: He wore a stylish broadcloths to the party.
meanings.sent2: The bride looked stunning in her white broadcloths.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his broadcloths instead of a hat.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a bright broadcloths in the dull room.
meanings.sent5: The cloak of invisibility was made from enchanted broadcloths.
